waitlist.title: So that you are never up to no good with your medical data you can try Nav29
waitlist.subtitle: An agent to manage your medical information. Nav29 can do tasks for you: store your medical information, your appointments, your reports, your data. Plus you can ask it anything you can think of about your illness because Nav29 uses AI in a way you've never seen before. You will have a medical agent at your fingertips 24 hours a day.
waitlist.jointitle: Sign up for the waiting list to be among the first to try Nav29, the app that will change medicine.
waitlist.msgJoined: Thank you for joining the waitlist. We will contact you as soon as possible.
waitlist.msgform: Thank you for joining the revolution!

land.s1.1: Health and AI together for you.
land.s1.2: Too much medical information? Do you need to manage it better?
land.s1.3: Nav29 allows you to organize your medical information and consultations with AI.
land.s2.1.2: Upload reports, appointments, medications and more.
land.s2.4: In testing: Nav29 may have errors. Thank you for your patience.
land.s3.1: Nav29, your ally to manage your medical information.

promts.0:
Behave like an expert in detecting sentence intentions. A patient writes the following sentence: '{{value}}'. 
Choose only one of the following intentions the patient wants to make: 
1.$Data (When providing information about the patient) 
2.$Question (When asks something or send something with the question mark) 
3.$Share (He must to tell you the word 'share') 
4.$Take Quiz (When he want to make a questionnaire) 
If it is none of this 4 intentions, returns: 
2.$Question
promts.1: Behave like a doctor. You have to give specific information and not general. Use only sources of medical information.

suggestions.s4: What is the patient's date of birth?
suggestions.s6: What is the main diagnosis of the report?
suggestions.s7: What is the main take away from the report?
suggestions.s8: What are the prescribed medications in this report?
suggestions.s9: What is the current condition of the patient according to this report?

suggestions.s11: What allergies does the patient have according to this report?

home.welcome: Thank you for signing up for Nav29!
home.subtitle: Let's start your journey to better health.
home.s0.1: Upload your first medical report now and let Nav29 start working for you.
home.s0.3: Once you've uploaded your first report, our system will analyze the information and be ready to answer your questions and help you better understand your health.
home.s0.4: Go ahead, take the first step toward smarter, more personalized medical data management!
home.s0.5: Your custom intelligence has been born and is feeding on your first report!
home.s0.6: Please wait a few seconds for it to finish. If the report is very large, it may take a few minutes.
home.s2.1: Your custom intelligence is feeding on another report!
home.docTile: These are the events that I have detected. Uncheck the wrong ones:
home.vetanal: We have analyzed your clinical analysis in Nav29!
home.vet1: We have analyzed your medical report in Nav29! Now we need your help to confirm the accuracy of the extracted data. Please:
home.vet2: Verify the identified data (appointments, medications, medical events)
home.vet3: Check events that have already occurred and are not relevant now.
home.vet4: Please report any incorrect or irrelevant information.
home.vet5: With your help, Nav29 will be able to provide you with more accurate and useful health information.
home.vet6: Provide end dates (if applicable) for diagnostics and medications. This information is crucial to your care and treatment.
home.botmsg1: Hi, I'm your AI assistant. You can ask me questions about health and I will be happy to help you. You can upload a report to provide you with more personalized information and answer your questions about the content of the document. You can do this from the icon below. During the conversation, I can detect and save new ones important events from what you tell me. You can also ask me about the saved data. I can also help you share this data with your doctor and provide you with questionnaires about your health.
home.botmsg2: Hello, how can I help you?
home.botmsg4:
Data not saved. 
 How can I help you?
home.placeholderError: We have not detected any text in the document.
home.donate_explanation: Your data can help improve and develop new medical tools and technologies. By donating your data, you contribute to medical research and the development of artificial intelligence in healthcare.
home.donate_anonymity: Your data will be completely anonymous. We have a process to anonymize uploaded documents and we do not share your data with third parties.

disclaimer.t1: Welcome to Summary29, your medical summary assistant
disclaimer.m1.1: Summary29 is designed to simplify your life, transforming extensive medical reports into structured, easy-to-understand summaries. Save time and effort reviewing documents and focus on what's most important!
disclaimer.m1.4: Just upload the medical report or medical reports you want to summarize.
disclaimer.m1.6: With a single click, our tool will create a structured summary, highlighting key information for quick and efficient understanding.
disclaimer.m1.8: Your opinion is valuable. After reviewing the summary, we invite you to provide feedback on the usability, clarity and quality of the generated summary. Help us improve and adjust to your needs!
disclaimer.m1.9: Upload your first report and discover the ease of understanding medical reports with Summary29.
disclaimer.t2: Privacy and data management at Summary29
disclaimer.m2.1: At Summary29, we value and protect your privacy. We adhere to the strictest regulations, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), to ensure that your information is secure and your rights respected.
disclaimer.m2.3: We do not store your Report: Once you upload a medical report for summary, we want you to know that we do not store the text of the report or any personal information related to it. We use the report exclusively to generate the summary and, Once this is done, the report data is immediately deleted from our servers.
disclaimer.m2.5: We only save the feedback you provide us, your comments and your email, in case you choose to leave us your data so we can contact you. Your opinion is essential to improve our services.
disclaimer.m2.7: We use advanced language models provided by Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services to generate medical report summaries. These providers are committed to protecting data privacy and security.
disclaimer.m2.8: Your rights and how to exercise them:
disclaimer.m2.9: You have the right to access, rectify, delete your personal data, as well as other rights detailed in the data protection regulations. If you wish to exercise any of these rights or have questions about our data management, please , please contact Fundaci√≥n 29 at support@foundaton29.org
disclaimer.m2.10: Your privacy and the security of your data are our priority. We work tirelessly to protect it and ensure that you have complete control over your information.

messages.m0: Processing of document {{value}} has started. The following tasks are going to be performed:
messages.m5.3: {{value}} documents are being anonymised. I will let you know when they are ready.
messages.m5.4: The document is being anonymized. I'll let you know when it's ready. It may take 1 or 2 minutes.
messages.m6.3: Patient summary is being created. I'll let you know when it's ready. It may take 1 or 2 minutes.
messages.expect0: Our artificial intelligence is hard at work analyzing your reports and comparing them against hundreds of sources of information to offer you the most accurate and personalized answer. This can take up to 1 minute. Thank you for your patience.
messages.expect1: Our artificial intelligence is carefully examining your reports and cross-checking them against numerous sources of information to provide you with the most accurate and personalized response. This process can take up to a minute. We appreciate your patience.
messages.expect2: Currently, our artificial intelligence system is processing your reports and comparing them with hundreds of databases to provide you with the most accurate response tailored to your needs. This procedure can take up to a minute. Thank you for your patience.
messages.expect3: Please be patient as our artificial intelligence works hard analyzing your reports and cross-checking them against hundreds of information sources. This process can take up to a minute to ensure an accurate and personalized response.
messages.expect4: We are using our artificial intelligence to analyze your reports and compare them against multiple sources of information, in order to provide you with the most accurate and personalized response possible. This task can take up to a minute. We appreciate your patience during this time.
messages.expect5: Our artificial intelligence is at work, analyzing your reports and comparing them with a vast amount of information sources to give you the best possible answer. This procedure can take up to a minute. Thank you for your understanding and patience.

messages.Arxiv: Checking Arxiv.org to find research papers that may help answer your query...
messages.Bing Search: Searching the web for relevant information...
messages.MediSearch: Searching the best medical databases for relevant information...
messages.Clinical Trials Search: Searching ClinicalTrials.gov for clinical trials that may be relevant to your query...
messages.Final Answer: Here is the answer to your query based on the information gathered...
messages.Drug Search: Searching our database of drugs to find relevant information...
messages.thanksvote: Thanks for sharing your opinion! It helps us to offer you a better service.

about.footer1: We are a non-profit organisation that designs and creates tools for patients to manage their own data, revolutionising the
about.footer2: diagnosis and management of rare diseases. We empower patients and doctors to use their medical data or their benefit and that
about.footer3: of the community. We believe there is a better way to do things centred on the patient and their data.
about.footer6: For any questions or queries, please contact us at

registration.consent: I consent the processing of my health data to foster investigation and improve treatment to Duchenne patients, as explained in the Privacy Policy.
registration.DDP: Processing of health-related data is one of the main purposes of DDP. Therefore, if you refuse this processing we cannot allow your registration to the platform.
registration.duchennepolicy: Duchenne Parent Project Netherlands is the data controller responsible for the processing of your personal data in relation with Duchenne Data Platform (‚ÄúDDP‚Äù). [Duchenne Parent Project NL] will process your personal data for allowing registration and use of DDP, being the legal basis for this processing the contractual relationship (disregarding the gratuity of the service) and your consent, when processing health-related data. We will not share your data with third parties; however, it may be accessed by our service providers where such access is necessary for the provision of the service. You have the right to access, rectify and erase your data, and other rights, as indicated in the Privacy Policy

dashboard.The platform is available via the intern: The platform is available via the internet or as an app on mobile devices for easy access to your data for patients and their families. Read the privacy policy here to see what is being done with your data.

phenotype.explanation of phenotyping 1: We call phenotype the set of observable symptoms that an individual presents as a result of the interaction between their genotype (set of genetic characteristics) and the environment that surrounds them. The process of studying these characteristics is known as phenotyping.
phenotype.explanation of phenotyping 2: The phenotype of an individual includes its morphology, its development, its biochemical characteristics, its physiology and its behavior. All of them are aspects that are very important to reach the diagnosis of a disease.
phenotype.explanation to add phenotype: You can complete the phenotype in several ways:
phenotype.select from the list: Selecting from the list of frequent symptoms
phenotype.info Extractor HPO: Copy and paste a medical report, or describe your symptoms

phenotype.Upload an image: Upload an image. Thanks to our HPO phenotype extractor, you will get your symptoms.

medication.Compassionate Use Description: Compassionate use is a treatment option that allows the use of an unauthorised medicine. Under strict conditions, products in development can be made available to groups of patients who have a disease with no satisfactory authorised therapies and who cannot enter clinical trials.

symptomssection.title: Symptoms
symptomssection.subtitleheader: By entering your symptoms you help better describe your disease for your community.
symptomssection.subtitle: Include the patient symptoms.
symptomssection.obsolete: This patient has symptoms considered as obsolete. It is recommended that you replace them with equivalent and up to date symptoms.
symptomssection.nosymptoms: The patient does not have symptoms.
symptomssection.No description: No description has been found for this symptom.
symptomssection.No synonyms: No synonyms have been found for this symptom.

symptomssection.want to close this window: Are you sure you want to close this window?
symptomssection.There might be repeated symptoms: There might be repeated symptoms in the case they belong to multiple groups.

geneticsection.title: Genetic information
geneticsection.subtitle1: If you have genetic information on the patient you can upload it here. We need the data in VCF format
geneticsection.subtitle2: What is this file and how to get it?
geneticsection.nogenetic: The patient doesn‚Äôt have genetic information. This is fine, you can continue to the next step.
geneticsection.pantelInfoVcfSubtitle: We explain here the importance of the VCF files and how to get them.
geneticsection.panelInfoVcfp1: In order to identify the cause of many rare diseases, the best strategy is to search for genetic characteristics that can be linked to the patient set of symptoms. These characteristics are known as variants. There are many variants, so they are usually put together in one or more Variant Call Format (VCF) files as candidate variants.
geneticsection.panelInfoVcfp2: It is usual that these files are never sent to the patient or the physicians by the labs, but in many cases, it is vital to reanalyze them as the patient symptoms progress. The patient has the right to have a copy of these files, so the easiest way to get them is for the patient to request a copy. Ask the patient to get in touch with us at support@foundation29.org and we will send a short tutorial on how to do it.
geneticsection.nogeneticinfo: There is no genetic information, do you want to continue?

reportsSection.subtitle: These are the files included in this case. You can review that their content has been correctly interpreted.
reportsSection.Name: Name

policy.step1: Who is the one responsible for the processing of your data?
policy.step2: With what purpose will your personal data be treated and for how long?
policy.step3: What is the legitimation of the treatment of data?
policy.step4: What rights does the interested one have?
policy.step1-1: In accordance with current regulations, the interested party is informed that the information provided will be processed by Fundaci√≥n 29 de Febrero (hereinafter, 'F29'), whose contact information is as follows
policy.step2-1: When users provide personal data through the forms on Nav29, their personal data will be processed for the following purposes
policy.step2-2: When users provide personal data through the user account creation form, the purpose is to manage the registration and administration of the user account registered in the application. For this, your personal data will be processed until you inform us of your wish to cancel your status as a registered user of Nav29.
policy.step2-3: Unless you indicate your will against, the legal preservation terms of the personal data indicated above will apply, so it is your responsibility to keep them updated, since they will be used to make communications about the additions, deletions or modifications of accounts registered.
policy.step3-1: Your data will be treated on the basis of the execution of the contract in the cases of user registration: without the processing of these data we could not carry out the aforementioned services.
policy.step4-1: The interested party has the right to
policy.step4-2: Get confirmation about whether personal data concerning you or not is being processed in F29.
policy.step4-5: Request the cancellation of your data when, among other reasons, the data is no longer necessary for the purposes for which it was collected.
policy.step4-6: To the portability of your data.
policy.step4-7: The exercise of these rights must be done through the email support@foundation29.org.
policy.step5-1: The personal data provided will not be transferred to third parties without prior authorization by the owner of the same.
policy.other1: Notwithstanding the foregoing, the interested party may contact F29 through support@foundation29.org
policy.other2: Likewise, when the interested party considers that the exercise of their rights has not been effective, they may file a complaint with the Spanish Agency for Data Protection.

others.browsers not supported: Currently we are not compatible with old browsers like Internet explorer. We recommend using modern browsers like  Microsoft Edge Insider, Chrome or Firefox.

footer.Dx29info: Nav29 is a search and reference tool provided for informational purposes and not intended to replace the clinician‚Äôs judgement or experience. It should not be used to diagnose or treat medical conditions.

step3-2.The file must have: The file must have .vcf, or .vcf.gz extension

home.keywords: Decentralized data, health data, Nav29, rare diseases, disease, epilepsy, seizures, genetic disease
home.description: Decentralized health data container where data is always with the patient. We also help patient groups to collect PROMs in aggregate form, with privacy as a top priority.
home.title: Nav29: Giving the power of data back to patients.

feel.q1: How has the patient's quality of life been this week?
feel.q2: Has the patient been able to go about their daily life (school, job, etc) on a regular basis?
feel.q3: How has the quality of life of the patient's caregivers been this week?
feel.Add a note describing how do you feel or: Add a note describing how do you feel or recent significant events

prom.no questionnaires: There are no questionnaires at this time
prom.subtitle: These are questionnaires from your Patient Organization to gather your opinion.
prom.You have completed: You have completed today's community questions. Thanks!

landraito.p1: We all agree that medical data can save lives. But they can only do so when we are able to put them together with other data. Your isolated medical data is worth little but if you group it, it is very valuable. Nav29 is the tool for your data to escape from a drawer and can be used to develop new treatments and you can improve your health or that of the people you care for.‚Äã
landraito.t2subtitle: Nav29 is a decentralized patient data container. Being decentralized you are the only one who has your data and you are the one who decides who you share it with. We give you the power to control your health data and that of the patients you care for. Here's how it works.
landraito.t2.1a: The first step is to create your personal data container. To do this, you have to prove that you are a real patient. It's a simple step that takes just a few minutes.
landraito.t2.2a: For your data to be worth there is a minimum information that you have to fill in, such as your disease, the group of patients to which you belong, etc. Don't worry, we've designed Nav29 to make this fast.
landraito.t2.3a: It is the most important step. Our mission is that you can use your data and for this we will help you share it with whoever you want. For example with your doctor and with your patient organization. If you want your data to be available anonymously for Research we will also help.
landraito.t3.1: Available on your mobile and tablet
landraito.t3.2: Use Nav29 on your phone or tablet: it is free and easy
landraito.You have a pending action before continu: You have a pending action before continuing.
landraito.check: I already understand what this is about. No need to see it more times.
landraito.optsub: Nav29 needs to know who you are. This will be the method you will use to access Nav29's functionality. We offer you several ways to do this, you can balance between convenience and privacy.
landraito.opt1: External Provider. We give you the possibility to log in with your account from another application. They are commercial applications and therefore these companies may know that you are a Nav29 user. They do not access your personal information. It's a good option if you're looking for simplicity and want to sacrifice a bit of your privacy.
landraito.opt2: Using your email. We offer you a service in which you do not have to use a password. Simple and effective. Every time you log in you will have to access your email. It is an effective way to maintain your privacy.
landraito.opt3: Using a wallet. It is the most complex method but it gives you more privacy. Using this method you will use a wallet that allows you to store private keys.
landraito.Install Metamask: Install Metamask to use this option
landraito.infoMetamask: If you want to access the functionality of Nav29 using a wallet like Metamask, you first need to install it. If not, don't worry, you have other alternatives.

homeraito.t1: Do you belong to a patient organization?
homeraito.t1.1: Thanks, joining a patient organization lets you boost research by aggregating your data with the data of other patients. We will ask you later to see whether you have joined.
homeraito.t2: Thanks, please select your patient organization
homeraito.t3: Do you want to share your data with your patient group?
homeraito.p1: This is your chance to change the future of your disease. Your data will be anonymised and aggregated with other patients' to boost quality of life studies, the development of new drugs and clinical research.
homeraito.p1.1: Your data will be sent periodically to your patient organization. You can grant and revoke access at any moment with a single tap from Nav29.
homeraito.p2.1: Ok, we will ask you later.
homeraito.Question: Question
homeraito.MsgDisclaimer: You are about to test GPT3, artificial intelligence system. It will answer your question automatically and there is no guarantee about the quality of the answer. Write your name if you agree and understand.
homeraito.Type a question in the text box: Type a question in the text box
homeraito.nothingFound: We have not found anything in my sources of information, the following response is obtained from a generic artificial intelligence and may contain errors:
homeraito.twho: Are you the patient or a caregiver?

charts.I want to answer how I feel today: I want to answer how I feel today
charts.There is no drug data stored: There is no drug data saved
charts.infoSeizures: Seizures are represented in total number indepentendtly of the type. If last quarter or last year is selected, then the data is the average number of seizures of the previous 7 days.
charts.infoDrugs: Drugs can be represented in percentage of the recommended drug dose or in absolute dose.
charts.infoFeel: Quality of life represents how the patient disease affects your life. The value in the graph is the average of the values you provide each time you answer the disease burden questions. The options in the questions have values from 1 to 5.
charts.If you dont keep data updated it will de: If you do not keep the data updated, the quality and usefulness of the data decreases, to help the community we need updated data. This bar reflects the update status of yours.
charts.noti1a: Welcome to Nav29, your personal data container. This is your notifications area.
charts.noti2a: The level of your container is represented in the bar below. You fill it entering and sharing data.
charts.noti3a: How has the disease burden been lately?
charts.noti3b: You haven't reported about your disease burden lately. Let's do it!
charts.noti4a: There are no recently saved seizures. Do you want to add a seizure?
charts.noti4b: You haven't added any seizures lately. Do you have seizures to add?
charts.noti5a: Your container doesn't have drugs data. Do you want to add some?
charts.noti5b: You haven't changed your drugs lately. Do you have anything to change?
charts.noti6a: You haven't joined a patient organization. Join now!
charts.noti7a: Your data is disconnected with your patient organization, do you want to connect it?

seizures.How do I export the data: How do I export the data?
seizures.INFODESCONOCIDA: If you do not know that seizure is
seizures.INFOPARCIALSIMPLE: A seizure limited to a specific area and side of the brain, without loss of consciousness.
seizures.INFOPARCIALCOMPLEJA: A seizure limited to a specific area and side of the brain, with the possibility of consciousness being lost or impaired.
seizures.INFOGENERALIZADA: A seizure beginning in a specific area of the brain and then progressing into a generalized seizure. It is important to describe the beginning of these seizures to possibly identify a focal region.
seizures.INFOTONICOCLONICAS: A seizure often referred to as grand mal seizures. These seizures begin with stiffening of the extremities followed by jerking of the extremities and face.
seizures.INFOMIOCLONIAS: A seizure with rapid, brief contractions of muscles, usually occurring at the same time on both sides of the body.
seizures.INFOCLUSTERMIOCLONICA: Same as an individual Myoclonic seizure but happens repetitively fairly close together. Seizure Tracker users have the capability of recording a related event count with this seizure type selection.
seizures.INFOATONICAS: A seizure with a sudden loss of muscle tone, often resulting in a sudden collapse. These seizures are also known as drop seizures.
seizures.INFOAUSENCIAS: A seizure with a brief lapse of awareness and or staring spell.
seizures.INFOAUSENCIAATIPICA: A seizure with a brief lapse of awareness and or staring spell but can be responsive.
seizures.INFOESPASMOS: Clusters of quick, sudden movements often occurring in children between 3 months and two years but can continue through later years.
seizures.INFOESTATUS: Status epilepticus is said to occur when a seizure lasts too long or when seizures occur close together and the patient doesn't recover between seizures.
seizures.Write down any details: Write down any details that could be important
seizures.These are the symptoms included in Nav29: These are the symptoms included in Nav29 by the user:
seizures.No symptoms have been added in Nav29: No symptoms have been added in Nav29.

mydata.title: My data container
mydata.desc: Your container is your own personal space to store your data and share it for your own disease management and research. Here you can manage your container.
mydata.a1: In Nav29 you are the only owner of your data. You can create a backup of your data, and we give you two possibilities to save it.
mydata.a0.1.2: The copy of your data is stored on Google servers.
mydata.a1.1.2: The copy of your data is stored on Fundaci√≥n 29's servers. Nobody but us will have access to your data.
mydata.a1.2.2: The copy of your data is stored in a decentralized network, being encrypted and distributed by the network. There is no entity that controls it.
mydata.a2.1: You are currently sharing data with the data network community of DSEF.
mydata.a2.2: Follow this link for more info: https://dravet.eu/
mydata.a2.5: If you want to stop your participation, revoke access here
mydata.a2.6: You haven't joined the DSEF data network community, please join below.
mydata.In RAITO you decide for your data: In Nav29 you decide for your data
mydata.Who has access to your data: Who has access to your data
mydata.When and for how long it is shared: When and for how long it is shared
mydata.Consent for editing and new input capabi: Consent for editing and new input capabilities
mydata.Use this dashboard to accept: Use this dashboard to accept, get informed or deny access to your data at anytime.
mydata.Share your data anonymously with your pa: Share your data anonymously with your patient group
mydata.You do not belong to any patient group: You do not belong to any patient group
mydata.Here is a message on why this is importa: Nav29 works with groups of patients to get data sets. It's the way you can collaborate in the research about your disease.
mydata.note1: In traditional systems, you don't have control of your data, but we want to change that.
mydata.note2: By giving consent to your organization to access your data anonymously, we use decentralized identity, so that you have control of your data, while maintaining privacy and security. You can give your consent and refuse it whenever you want.
mydata.note3: When you give your consent, you will have the proof of it on your mobile phone.
mydata.note4: If you change the organization, you will stop sharing with the previous organization, and you will have to give consent again for the new one you have selected.
mydata.vcintro1: So that you have proof that you have shared your data, decentralized identity verification (blockchain technology) is used, which respects your privacy and security, for which Microsoft Authenticator is used.
mydata.vcintro2: Download Microsoft Authenticator, open the app, and in the section of 'Verified IDs' scan the QR that appears below. You will have on your mobile device the card that proves that you are sharing your data.
mydata.exportText: A single file with all your current data will be downloaded to your device. You can them keep this file or share it with institutions, researchers through any application you choose.
mydata.All data saved with FHIR standard: All data saved with FHIR standard
mydata.FHIR1: FHIR, pronounced 'fire', stands for Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources. It is a common language used by multiple medical information systems. As common languages do, it allows communication between them. Having your data in FHIR means that you can take it to many hospitals in the world and they will be able to read it and incorporate in your medical record.
mydata.sharepart1: You can download or share a summary report of your data. You can also download or share an anonymized copy of your data for research.
mydata.sharecontent1: The report includes seizure, quality of life and medication graphs, as well as your list of symptoms.
mydata.sharecontent2: You can share your data with researchers for the purpose of data aggregation and analysis.
mydata.sharecontent3: A private link will be generated that you can share with the people you want to access it.
mydata.fhirdesc: Having your data in FHIR means that you can take it to many hospitals around the world and they will be able to read it and incorporate it into your medical record.
mydata.incorrect account: You have selected an incorrect account.
mydata.we will close your session: For your security, we will close your session.
mydata.please enter your password: For security reasons, please enter your password

prereg.title: This is how we manage data
prereg.subtitle: You need to read the complete text of the Privacy Policy for legal purposes, but we really don't like this requirement so we made a summary for you.
prereg.a1: Nav29 will only know your name, last name and email. Your patient group may receive anonymous medical information to support research in your disease. You can finally participate directly with your knowledge!
prereg.a2.1: You may share your medical data anonymously with your Patient Organization by granting access to it. You can also send anonymous copies to whoever you want.
prereg.a3: Nav29 will store only name and contact information, while your medical data will be stored where you choose. You can store it in your device or in your cloud storage provider. Nav29 will help you with this. We call this folder your own data container.
prereg.a4: Nobody else has access to your data. Your data is yours and is safe.
prereg.t6: What data is shared with F29?
prereg.a6: Nav29 collects basic user information data. In order to provide you with Nav29‚Äôs services, we collect your name and email. All the other data that you include in Nav29 is stored in your own device or your own cloud storage service, so F29 does not have access to it.
prereg.readPolicy: Read the full version of the Privacy Policy here

documents.Title: Title

termsDravet.title: Privacy policy
termsDravet.t1: Who is the one responsible for the processing of your data?
termsDravet.a1.1: In accordance with current regulations, the interested party is informed that the information provided will be processed by Dravet Syndrome European Federation (hereinafter, 'DSEF), whose contact information is as follows:
termsDravet.a1.2: Registered office: c/o Irena Bibic, Don Rafaela Radice 11, 21 251 Zrnovnica, Split, Croatia
termsDravet.t2: What data is shared with DSEF?
termsDravet.a2: Only anonymous data is shared with DSEF. In your personal data container, data that identifies you as a person is separated from medical data. This medical data is effectively anonymous and can be shared without revealing your identity. This is the data that is periodically sent to DSEF.
termsDravet.t3: How often is data shared with DSEF?
termsDravet.a3: Your personal data container is continuously synchronizing with the aggregated data container stored by DSEF. So new data will be sent once you update your container information. Depending on the situation, it can be sent right away or once a day.
termsDravet.t4: With what purpose will your anonymous data be treated and for how long?
termsDravet.a4.1: When users provide anonymous data through the connection established between their personal data container and DSEF‚Äôs data container, their anonymous data will be processed for the following purposes:
termsDravet.a4.2: Your anonymous data will be aggregated with the data from other Nav29 users.
termsDravet.a4.3: The aggregated data will be used for multiple research projects to identify the key traits of Dravet syndrome patients and to provide evidence about the quality of life of Dravet syndrome families.
termsDravet.t5: What is the legitimation of the treatment of data?
termsDravet.a5: Your data will be treated on the basis of your expressed enrollment into the research program.
termsDravet.t6: What rights does the interested one have?
termsDravet.a6.1: The interested party has the right to:
termsDravet.a6.3: Request the cancellation of your data when, among other reasons, the data is no longer necessary for the purposes for which it was collected.
termsDravet.a6.4: To the portability of your data.
termsDravet.a6.5: The exercise of these rights must be done through the email info@dravet.eu.
termsDravet.a7: The personal data provided will not be transferred to third parties without prior authorization by the owner of the same.
termsDravet.footer1: Notwithstanding the foregoing, the interested party may contact DSEF through info@dravet.eu
termsDravet.footer2: Likewise, when the interested party considers that the exercise of their rights has not been effective, they may file a complaint with the Croatian Agency for Data Protection.

open.perm1title: See patient's age, name and gender
open.The accesses to your data will be shown: The accesses to your data will be shown here
open.InfoPermissions: Select what information researchers will be able to see. You can also add an informative note.
open.nosharing: You have not created any sharing links
open.infoshare1: This app allows you to share your medical data with anyone you want, in a secure and controlled way. By generating an invitation link or a QR code, you are allowing the person who receives it to access your medical information.
open.infoshare2: The key to this process is that you are in complete control. At any time you can delete the invitation and, in doing so, the person you shared it with will no longer have access to your data.
open.infoshare3: To maintain more detailed control, we recommend that you generate different invitations for different people. That way, if at some point you decide that a particular person should no longer have access, you can simply delete their invitation rather than having to remove access for everyone.
open.infoshare4: We have included a notes field for each invitation you generate. Here you can add any details that will help you identify who you are giving access to. It could be the person's name, their relationship to you, the reason you are sharing your data with them, or any other information you find useful.
open.infoshare5: Remember, the management of your medical data is personal and should be controlled by you. This functionality is designed to help you do just that.
open.Notecustom: Invitation created automatically when generating the PDF.
open.infoDownloadPDF: By downloading this PDF, you have generated a link and a unique QR code that allows anyone with access to the document to view your medical information. This link and QR can be managed from the 'Share' section of the application. Remember, you have full control over who can access your data. You can remove the link at any time to prevent access to your information. We recommend that you keep track of who you share this document with to protect your privacy.
open.instructionMA: If you do not have Microsoft Authenticator, you can download it here
